ygData.subject: Re: Piercing or blunt? (Q about weapon skill)
ygData.msgSnippet: ... was only 80 or ... Well INT is definitely supposed to mean faster learning.  But in the scenario of meleeing, in general it may not be much of a difference
ygData.messageBody:
>Playing my wizard I have really not noticed
>faster weapon skill gain than what my ranger had (his int
was only 80 or
>something).

Well INT is definitely supposed to mean faster learning. But in the
scenario of meleeing, in general it may not be much of a difference when you
do it so much.

>As to your skills increasing slowly, that is strange. When
my ranger got to
>about level 17 and he got a screaming mace, his 1h blunt
skill was 0. I
>went to unrest and got permission from the groups there to
get some whacks
>in on the mobs they were fighting (many of which were
white/black or yellow
>cons). It took me a while, but skill steadily improved
from 0 all the way
>to max of 100 at level 19.

That is why I suggested there is a bug or design flaw. The only common
thread of all the complaints on message boards is they were all Level 14 or
higher mage classes using the 2H Blunt (Runed Totem Staff) skill for the
first time and it was hardly improving at all, even though they were at 0!!
I've had my RTS for three levels now and the only reason I am at skill of 20
on 2H Blunt is because I pumped 15 practice points into it after spending a
whole level of going nowhere with that skill. Something's not right here.
